snippet: The body of civil law enacted with Western assistance and the classic Islamic code of Shariah protect the rights of women not to be forced into marriage. Tribal codes do not.
abstract: Afghan Women's Network estimates that 150 honor killings occur annually in Afghanistan to absolve various sorts of family shame; body of civil law enacted with Western assistance, and classic Islamic code of Shariah, protect rights of women not to be forced into marriage, but tribal codes do not.
lead_paragraph: The body of civil law enacted with Western assistance and the classic Islamic code of Shariah protect the rights of women not to be forced into marriage. Tribal codes do not.

headline.main: In Spite of the Law, Afghan ‘Honor Killings’ of Women Continue
headline.print_headline: In Spite of the Law, Afghan ‘Honor Killings’ of Women Continue
